intro: Gethyllis setosa, commonly known as the tufted winterbloom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous structure. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers during the winter months. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, emerging from the base of the plant. Gethyllis setosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
